description: Next.js project initializes, builds, and runs correctly with TypeScript
steps: Step 1: Run 'pnpm install' to install dependencies
Step 2: Verify package.json contains Next.js, React, and TypeScript dependencies
Step 3: Verify tsconfig.json exists with strict mode enabled
Step 4: Run 'pnpm build' to build the production bundle
Step 5: Verify build completes successfully with exit code 0
Step 6: Verify no TypeScript errors in build output
Step 7: Verify static pages are generated in .next directory
Step 8: Run 'pnpm start' to start production server
Step 9: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 10: Verify the homepage loads without errors
Step 11: Verify no console errors in browser developer tools

description: Development server starts and enables hot module replacement
steps: Step 1: Run 'pnpm dev' to start development server
Step 2: Navigate to http://localhost:3000
Step 3: Verify the homepage loads without errors
Step 4: Verify no console errors in browser developer tools

description: Homepage hero section displays complete professional identity with CTAs
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage (http://localhost:3000)
Step 2: Verify hero section is visible above the fold
Step 3: Verify professional name is displayed prominently as largest text
Step 4: Verify role/title is clearly visible (e.g., 'Senior Full-Stack Engineer')
Step 5: Verify value proposition text describes unique value
Step 6: Verify hero section has proper visual hierarchy
Step 7: Locate 'View Projects' primary CTA button
Step 8: Click 'View Projects' button and verify navigation to /projects
Step 9: Navigate back to homepage
Step 10: Locate 'Download Resume' secondary CTA button
Step 11: Verify resume button initiates download or navigates to /resume
Step 12: Verify availability indicator shows current status

description: Homepage proof strip displays concrete quality signals and metrics
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Scroll to proof strip section below hero
Step 3: Verify proof strip section is visually distinct
Step 4: Verify at least 3 quality signals are displayed
Step 5: Verify signals include concrete metrics (e.g., test coverage, years experience)
Step 6: Verify signals have icons or visual indicators
Step 7: Verify text is scannable and concise
Step 8: Verify section works in both light and dark modes
Step 9: Resize viewport to mobile width
Step 10: Verify proof strip remains readable on mobile

description: Homepage featured projects section showcases 2-3 key projects with full interactivity
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Scroll to featured projects section
Step 3: Verify section header 'Featured Projects' or similar is visible
Step 4: Count the number of project cards displayed
Step 5: Verify 2-3 project cards are shown (not more, not less)
Step 6: Verify each card has project title
Step 7: Verify each card has project summary/description
Step 8: Verify each card displays technology badges
Step 9: Verify each card has a visual (image or placeholder)
Step 10: Hover over first project card and verify hover effect
Step 11: Click on first project card
Step 12: Verify navigation to individual project page (/projects/[slug])

description: Homepage skills section displays categorized skills with proficiency indicators
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Scroll to skills section
Step 3: Verify skills section header is visible
Step 4: Verify skills are grouped into categories (frontend, backend, devops, etc.)
Step 5: Verify at least 3 different skill categories exist
Step 6: Verify each category has a clear heading
Step 7: Verify each skill has a name displayed
Step 8: Verify each skill has a proficiency indicator (bar, dots, or level)
Step 9: Verify skill icons are displayed where appropriate
Step 10: Verify skills are sorted logically within categories
Step 11: Switch to dark mode and verify skills display correctly

description: Homepage displays availability indicator and call-to-action footer
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Look for availability indicator (e.g., 'Open to opportunities')
Step 3: Verify indicator is clearly visible with appropriate color
Step 4: Scroll to bottom of page
Step 5: Verify CTA section exists before footer
Step 6: Verify CTA has compelling headline
Step 7: Verify contact button or links are present
Step 8: Click on contact link/button
Step 9: Verify navigation to /contact or contact action
Step 10: Navigate back and verify footer social links are present

description: Navigation bar displays all sections, is sticky, and highlights current page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Verify navigation bar is visible at top of page
Step 3: Verify navigation includes: Home link or logo
Step 4: Verify navigation includes: Projects link
Step 5: Verify navigation includes: About link
Step 6: Verify navigation includes: Resume link
Step 7: Verify navigation includes: Contact link
Step 8: Scroll down the page significantly
Step 9: Verify navigation bar remains visible (sticky behavior)
Step 10: Click on 'About' in navigation
Step 11: Verify navigation to /about page
Step 12: Verify 'About' link is highlighted as current page
Step 13: Click on 'Projects' link
Step 14: Verify 'Projects' is now highlighted and 'About' is not

description: Mobile navigation uses hamburger menu with full functionality
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to mobile size (375px width)
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify hamburger menu icon is visible
Step 4: Verify main nav links are hidden (not visible)
Step 5: Click hamburger menu icon
Step 6: Verify mobile menu opens with animation
Step 7: Verify all navigation links are visible in menu
Step 8: Verify menu has appropriate styling/backdrop
Step 9: Click on 'Projects' link in mobile menu
Step 10: Verify navigation to /projects page
Step 11: Verify mobile menu closes after navigation
Step 12: Open mobile menu again
Step 13: Click outside menu or press escape
Step 14: Verify menu closes

description: Projects page displays filterable project grid with all filter options
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Verify projects page header is visible
Step 3: Verify project grid displays all projects
Step 4: Count total number of projects displayed
Step 5: Verify filter controls section is visible
Step 6: Locate technology filter options
Step 7: Click on a technology filter (e.g., 'React')
Step 8: Verify grid updates to show only matching projects
Step 9: Verify filtered count is less than total
Step 10: Clear the technology filter
Step 11: Verify all projects are displayed again
Step 12: Apply a different filter type (domain or status)
Step 13: Verify filtering works for that category
Step 14: Clear all filters and verify full list returns

description: Projects can be filtered by technology stack (React, Python, Go, TypeScript, etc.)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Locate technology filter options
Step 3: Note the total project count
Step 4: Click on 'React' filter
Step 5: Verify only projects using React are displayed
Step 6: Verify each visible project has React in its tech stack
Step 7: Clear filter
Step 8: Click on 'TypeScript' filter if available
Step 9: Verify TypeScript projects are shown
Step 10: Verify filter state is visually indicated (selected state)

description: Projects can be filtered by domain (web, backend, AI/ML, devops)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Locate domain filter options
Step 3: Click on 'backend' domain filter
Step 4: Verify only backend projects are displayed
Step 5: Clear filter
Step 6: Click on 'web' or 'frontend' domain filter
Step 7: Verify only web/frontend projects are displayed
Step 8: Clear filter
Step 9: Click on 'AI/ML' domain filter if available
Step 10: Verify AI/ML projects are displayed

description: Projects can be filtered by type (professional, open-source, learning, personal)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Locate type filter options
Step 3: Click on 'open-source' type filter
Step 4: Verify only open-source projects are displayed
Step 5: Verify each project has open-source indicator
Step 6: Clear filter
Step 7: Click on 'professional' type filter
Step 8: Verify only professional projects are displayed
Step 9: Clear filter
Step 10: Click on 'personal' or 'learning' filter if available

description: Projects can be filtered by status (complete, in-progress, archived)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Locate status filter options
Step 3: Click on 'in-progress' status filter
Step 4: Verify only in-progress projects are displayed
Step 5: Verify each project shows WIP or in-progress indicator
Step 6: Clear filter
Step 7: Click on 'complete' status filter
Step 8: Verify only complete projects are displayed
Step 9: Clear filter
Step 10: Click on 'archived' filter if available

description: Individual project case study page displays complete standardized structure
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Click on first project card to open project detail
Step 3: Verify page URL matches /projects/[slug] pattern
Step 4: Verify project title is displayed as H1
Step 5: Verify technology stack badges are displayed near top
Step 6: Verify 'Problem' section is present with content
Step 7: Verify 'Constraints' section is present or mentioned
Step 8: Verify 'Solution' section is present with detailed content
Step 9: Verify 'Architecture' section or diagram is present
Step 10: Verify 'Key Features' section lists main features
Step 11: Verify 'Tradeoffs' section discusses decisions made
Step 12: Verify 'What I'd Do Next' or reflection section exists
Step 13: Verify GitHub repository link is clickable
Step 14: Verify live demo link if project has one
Step 15: Verify project metadata (date, duration, team size) is shown

description: Project page displays technology stack with proper badges and links
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any project detail page
Step 2: Locate technology stack section
Step 3: Verify technology badges are displayed
Step 4: Count number of technologies shown
Step 5: Verify each badge shows technology name clearly
Step 6: Verify badges have consistent styling
Step 7: Verify badges have appropriate colors or icons
Step 8: Check if technologies are clickable (filter by tech)
Step 9: Verify technologies match what's shown on project card
Step 10: Switch to dark mode and verify badge visibility

description: Project page displays external links with proper behavior and status indicators
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any project detail page
Step 2: Locate project links section (GitHub, Live Demo)
Step 3: Verify GitHub repository link is present
Step 4: Verify GitHub link has appropriate icon
Step 5: Click GitHub link
Step 6: Verify it opens in new tab (target=_blank)
Step 7: Verify original tab remains on portfolio
Step 8: Close new tab and return to project page
Step 9: If live demo exists, verify demo link is present
Step 10: Verify demo link has status indicator if applicable
Step 11: Verify links have hover states

description: Project page shows related projects and navigation between projects
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Note the order of projects
Step 3: Click on first project to view detail
Step 4: Scroll to bottom of case study content
Step 5: Verify 'Related Projects' section exists
Step 6: Verify at least 1-2 related projects are shown
Step 7: Verify related projects are relevant (similar tech or domain)
Step 8: Click on a related project
Step 9: Verify navigation to that project's page
Step 10: Locate prev/next project navigation
Step 11: Click 'Next Project' if available
Step 12: Verify navigation to next project in sequence

description: Resume page provides complete resume access with multiple format options
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /resume
Step 2: Verify resume page header is visible
Step 3: Verify PDF viewer is embedded OR prominent download available
Step 4: If PDF viewer: verify resume content is visible and readable
Step 5: If PDF viewer: verify can scroll through resume
Step 6: Locate download button(s)
Step 7: Verify PDF download option exists
Step 8: Click PDF download button
Step 9: Verify PDF file downloads successfully
Step 10: Check for additional format options (DOCX, TXT)
Step 11: Verify 'Last Updated' timestamp is visible
Step 12: Verify timestamp shows a reasonable recent date

description: About page displays comprehensive professional narrative and career information
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /about
Step 2: Verify about page header is visible
Step 3: Verify professional headshot or avatar is displayed
Step 4: Verify professional narrative section has substantial content
Step 5: Verify narrative spans multiple paragraphs
Step 6: Verify career background information is present
Step 7: Scroll to career section
Step 8: Verify timeline or career journey visualization exists
Step 9: Verify at least 2-3 career milestones are shown
Step 10: Verify each milestone has date and description
Step 11: Locate 'How I Work' section
Step 12: Verify collaboration preferences are described
Step 13: Locate target roles section
Step 14: Verify roles being sought are clearly stated

description: Contact page provides complete contact options with response expectations
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Verify contact page header is visible
Step 3: Verify email contact method is displayed
Step 4: Verify email is clickable (mailto: link)
Step 5: Verify GitHub link is present with icon
Step 6: Click GitHub link and verify external navigation
Step 7: Return to contact page
Step 8: Verify LinkedIn link is present with icon
Step 9: Click LinkedIn link and verify external navigation
Step 10: Return to contact page
Step 11: Look for response time information
Step 12: Verify text like 'typically respond within 48 hours' exists
Step 13: Verify preferred contact method is indicated

description: Contact form validates input, submits successfully, and provides feedback
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Locate contact form
Step 3: Leave all fields empty
Step 4: Click submit button
Step 5: Verify validation error messages appear for required fields
Step 6: Fill in name field with 'Test User'
Step 7: Submit form with only name filled
Step 8: Verify email validation error appears
Step 9: Enter invalid email format (e.g., 'notanemail')
Step 10: Verify email format error message appears
Step 11: Enter valid email 'test@example.com'
Step 12: Submit with empty message field
Step 13: Verify message required error appears
Step 14: Fill in message field with 'This is a test message'
Step 15: Submit the complete form
Step 16: Verify success message or toast appears
Step 17: Verify form is cleared or confirmation shown

description: Theme toggle switches between light, dark, and system modes with persistence
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Locate theme toggle button in navigation or settings
Step 3: Note current theme (check background and text colors)
Step 4: Click theme toggle
Step 5: Verify theme changes (background, text, component colors)
Step 6: Click toggle again to switch to next mode
Step 7: Verify theme changes appropriately
Step 8: Navigate to /about page
Step 9: Verify selected theme persists across navigation
Step 10: Refresh the browser (F5)
Step 11: Verify theme preference persists after refresh
Step 12: Verify no flash of wrong theme on page load

description: System theme preference is respected on first visit and can be overridden
steps: Step 1: Set OS/browser to dark mode preference
Step 2: Clear site localStorage/cookies
Step 3: Navigate to homepage in incognito/private window
Step 4: Verify site automatically uses dark theme
Step 5: Set OS to light mode preference
Step 6: Open new incognito window
Step 7: Navigate to homepage
Step 8: Verify site automatically uses light theme
Step 9: Manually toggle to dark mode
Step 10: Verify manual selection overrides system preference

description: Code snippets display with syntax highlighting and copy functionality
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a project detail page containing code snippets
Step 2: Locate code snippet section
Step 3: Verify code has syntax highlighting (colored keywords)
Step 4: Verify line numbers are displayed
Step 5: Verify code block has distinct background styling
Step 6: Verify code uses monospace font
Step 7: Locate copy button on code block
Step 8: Click copy button
Step 9: Verify visual feedback (button changes, tooltip, or checkmark)
Step 10: Open a text editor and paste
Step 11: Verify code was copied correctly
Step 12: Verify code maintains proper formatting

description: 404 page displays helpful content and navigation for missing routes
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a non-existent route (e.g., /nonexistent-page-xyz)
Step 2: Verify 404 page is displayed
Step 3: Verify helpful message explains page was not found
Step 4: Verify navigation links to main pages are provided
Step 5: Verify 'Go Home' or 'Back to Homepage' link exists
Step 6: Click 'Go Home' link
Step 7: Verify navigation to homepage succeeds
Step 8: Navigate to invalid project slug (e.g., /projects/fake-project-123)
Step 9: Verify 404 page displays for invalid project
Step 10: Verify navigation still works from 404 page

description: Sitemap.xml is generated with all pages and proper formatting
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /sitemap.xml
Step 2: Verify XML sitemap is returned (not 404)
Step 3: Verify XML is properly formatted
Step 4: Verify sitemap includes homepage URL
Step 5: Verify sitemap includes /projects page
Step 6: Verify sitemap includes /about page
Step 7: Verify sitemap includes /resume page
Step 8: Verify sitemap includes /contact page
Step 9: Verify sitemap includes individual project pages
Step 10: Verify all URLs use correct domain

description: Robots.txt is present with proper crawl directives and sitemap reference
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /robots.txt
Step 2: Verify robots.txt file is returned
Step 3: Verify User-agent directive is present
Step 4: Verify sitemap URL is referenced
Step 5: Verify no important pages are disallowed
Step 6: Verify _next or build artifacts are handled appropriately

description: All internal navigation links work correctly across the entire site
steps: Step 1: Start at homepage
Step 2: Click 'Projects' navigation link
Step 3: Verify navigation to /projects succeeds
Step 4: Click 'About' navigation link
Step 5: Verify navigation to /about succeeds
Step 6: Click 'Resume' navigation link
Step 7: Verify navigation to /resume succeeds
Step 8: Click 'Contact' navigation link
Step 9: Verify navigation to /contact succeeds
Step 10: Click logo or 'Home' to return to homepage
Step 11: Verify homepage loads correctly
Step 12: Click any CTA button and verify navigation
Step 13: Navigate to /projects and click a project
Step 14: Verify project detail page loads

description: External links open in new tab with proper security attributes
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact page
Step 2: Right-click GitHub link and inspect element
Step 3: Verify target='_blank' attribute is present
Step 4: Verify rel='noopener noreferrer' or similar is present
Step 5: Click GitHub link
Step 6: Verify link opens in new browser tab
Step 7: Verify original tab remains on portfolio site
Step 8: Close new tab and return to portfolio
Step 9: Test LinkedIn link similarly
Step 10: Navigate to project page and test GitHub repo link

description: Page metadata (title, description) is set correctly and uniquely for each page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Inspect page title in browser tab
Step 3: Verify title includes name and professional context
Step 4: View page source and find meta description
Step 5: Verify description is unique and relevant to homepage
Step 6: Navigate to /projects
Step 7: Verify title updates to reflect Projects page
Step 8: Navigate to /about
Step 9: Verify title includes 'About' context
Step 10: Navigate to a project detail page
Step 11: Verify title includes project name
Step 12: Verify meta description is project-specific

description: OpenGraph and Twitter card metadata is complete for social sharing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source
Step 3: Verify og:title meta tag is present
Step 4: Verify og:description meta tag is present
Step 5: Verify og:image meta tag is present with valid URL
Step 6: Verify og:url meta tag is present
Step 7: Verify og:type meta tag is present
Step 8: Verify twitter:card meta tag is present
Step 9: Verify twitter:title meta tag is present
Step 10: Navigate to a project page
Step 11: Verify project-specific OG tags are set
Step 12: Verify og:image shows project-related image

description: Skip-to-content link is accessible and functions correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Press Tab key as first keyboard interaction
Step 3: Verify 'Skip to content' or 'Skip to main' link appears/focuses
Step 4: Verify skip link is visually visible when focused
Step 5: Press Enter on skip link
Step 6: Verify focus moves to main content area
Step 7: Verify main content is now keyboard navigable
Step 8: Navigate to /projects and repeat test
Step 9: Verify skip link works consistently across pages

description: All interactive elements are fully keyboard accessible
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Use Tab key to navigate through all interactive elements
Step 3: Verify all navigation links can be focused
Step 4: Verify all buttons can be focused
Step 5: Press Enter on focused navigation link
Step 6: Verify navigation occurs
Step 7: Navigate to /contact
Step 8: Tab through form fields
Step 9: Verify all form inputs can be focused via Tab
Step 10: Fill form using only keyboard
Step 11: Submit form using Enter key
Step 12: Verify form submission works via keyboard

description: Focus indicators are visible and meet contrast requirements
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Use Tab to focus on first interactive element
Step 3: Verify visible focus indicator (outline, ring, or background)
Step 4: Verify focus indicator has sufficient contrast (3:1 minimum)
Step 5: Tab through navigation links
Step 6: Verify each link shows visible focus indicator
Step 7: Tab to CTA buttons
Step 8: Verify buttons show clear focus indicator
Step 9: Navigate to /contact and tab through form
Step 10: Verify form fields show focus indicators
Step 11: Switch to dark mode and verify focus indicators still visible

description: All images have appropriate and meaningful alt text
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Inspect hero image or avatar (if present)
Step 3: Verify alt attribute is present and descriptive
Step 4: Navigate to /about page
Step 5: Inspect profile photo
Step 6: Verify alt text describes the image meaningfully
Step 7: Navigate to /projects
Step 8: Inspect project card images
Step 9: Verify each project image has alt text
Step 10: Navigate to project detail page
Step 11: Inspect any screenshots or diagrams
Step 12: Verify architecture diagrams have descriptive alt text

description: JSON-LD structured data is present and valid for Person schema
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source
Step 3: Search for 'application/ld+json' script tag
Step 4: Verify script tag with type application/ld+json exists
Step 5: Parse the JSON content
Step 6: Verify @context is 'https://schema.org'
Step 7: Verify @type is 'Person'
Step 8: Verify 'name' property is present
Step 9: Verify 'jobTitle' property is present
Step 10: Verify 'url' property matches site URL
Step 11: Copy JSON-LD and validate at schema.org validator

description: Performance achieves Lighthouse score 90+ on mobile for all pages
steps: Step 1: Build production version with 'pnpm build'
Step 2: Start production server with 'pnpm start'
Step 3: Open Chrome DevTools and go to Lighthouse tab
Step 4: Run Lighthouse audit on homepage (mobile mode)
Step 5: Verify Performance score is 90 or higher
Step 6: Verify LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) is under 2.5 seconds
Step 7: Verify CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) is under 0.1
Step 8: Run audit on /projects page
Step 9: Verify Performance score is 90 or higher
Step 10: Run audit on a project detail page
Step 11: Verify Performance score is 90 or higher

description: Accessibility achieves Lighthouse accessibility score 100
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse audit on homepage
Step 2: Navigate to Accessibility section of report
Step 3: Verify Accessibility score is 100
Step 4: If not 100, note and fix any issues
Step 5: Run audit on /about page
Step 6: Verify Accessibility score is 100
Step 7: Run audit on /contact page
Step 8: Verify Accessibility score is 100
Step 9: Run audit on /projects page
Step 10: Verify Accessibility score is 100
Step 11: Run audit on a project detail page
Step 12: Verify Accessibility score is 100

description: SEO achieves Lighthouse SEO score 100 across all pages
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse audit on homepage
Step 2: Navigate to SEO section of report
Step 3: Verify SEO score is 100
Step 4: Run audit on /projects page
Step 5: Verify SEO score is 100
Step 6: Run audit on /about page
Step 7: Verify SEO score is 100
Step 8: Run audit on project detail pages
Step 9: Verify SEO score is 100 for project pages
Step 10: Verify all pages have unique titles and descriptions

description: TypeScript strict mode compiles without errors throughout codebase
steps: Step 1: Verify tsconfig.json has 'strict': true
Step 2: Run 'pnpm typecheck' or 'npx tsc --noEmit'
Step 3: Verify no TypeScript errors are reported
Step 4: Verify all components have proper type annotations
Step 5: Verify props interfaces are defined
Step 6: Verify data files have proper types
Step 7: Make intentional type error and verify it's caught
Step 8: Fix error and verify clean typecheck

description: ESLint passes with no errors and enforces code quality
steps: Step 1: Run 'pnpm lint' or 'npx eslint .'
Step 2: Verify no ESLint errors are reported
Step 3: Check for any warnings on critical rules
Step 4: Verify accessibility eslint plugin rules pass
Step 5: Verify React hooks rules pass
Step 6: Check .eslintrc configuration exists
Step 7: Verify strict rules are enabled

description: Content data files validate against Zod schemas
steps: Step 1: Locate data validation scripts or schemas
Step 2: Find Zod schema definitions for Project type
Step 3: Run schema validation on projects data
Step 4: Verify all projects pass schema validation
Step 5: Find Zod schema for Skill type
Step 6: Run validation on skills data
Step 7: Find Zod schema for Metadata type
Step 8: Run validation on site metadata
Step 9: Intentionally break data and verify validation fails
Step 10: Fix data and verify validation passes

description: Security headers are properly configured in production
steps: Step 1: Build and deploy site to production/preview
Step 2: Use browser dev tools to inspect response headers
Step 3: Verify Content-Security-Policy header is present
Step 4: Verify X-Frame-Options is set to 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN'
Step 5: Verify X-Content-Type-Options is 'nosniff'
Step 6: Verify Referrer-Policy is set appropriately
Step 7: Verify Permissions-Policy is configured
Step 8: Use security header checker tool to validate
Step 9: Verify no security warnings in report

description: Contact form has honeypot and rate limiting spam protection
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Inspect form HTML source
Step 3: Verify hidden honeypot field exists (visually hidden)
Step 4: Verify honeypot field has tabindex=-1 or similar
Step 5: Fill visible form fields with valid data
Step 6: Submit form normally
Step 7: Verify success message appears
Step 8: Use dev tools to fill honeypot field
Step 9: Submit form with honeypot filled
Step 10: Verify form is rejected or silently discarded
Step 11: Submit form multiple times rapidly
Step 12: Verify rate limiting kicks in after several submissions

description: Images are optimized using next/image with proper formats and lazy loading
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Open browser Network tab, filter by images
Step 3: Verify images are served in WebP or AVIF format
Step 4: Verify images have appropriate sizes for viewport
Step 5: Scroll page slowly and observe network requests
Step 6: Verify below-fold images load lazily (on scroll)
Step 7: Inspect image elements in dev tools
Step 8: Verify next/image attributes are present
Step 9: Resize viewport and verify responsive images
Step 10: Verify no layout shift when images load (CLS)

description: Fonts are optimized, preloaded, and display without FOIT
steps: Step 1: View page source of homepage
Step 2: Look for font preload links in <head>
Step 3: Verify preload links have correct font URLs
Step 4: Verify font-display: swap is used
Step 5: Throttle network to Slow 3G in dev tools
Step 6: Hard refresh the page
Step 7: Verify no Flash of Invisible Text (FOIT)
Step 8: Verify fallback fonts display immediately
Step 9: Verify custom fonts load smoothly
Step 10: Verify minimal Flash of Unstyled Text (FOUT)

description: Homepage hero section has correct visual hierarchy and spacing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Take screenshot of hero section
Step 3: Verify name is the largest text element (approximately 2.5rem+)
Step 4: Verify role/title is second largest text
Step 5: Verify value proposition is readable body size
Step 6: Verify CTA buttons are visually prominent
Step 7: Verify adequate whitespace around all elements
Step 8: Verify vertical rhythm is consistent
Step 9: Verify hero doesn't feel cramped or too sparse
Step 10: Verify hero looks balanced on desktop viewport

description: Typography follows design system scale consistently across all pages
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Inspect H1 element and verify size (approximately 2.5rem)
Step 3: Navigate to /about page
Step 4: Verify H1 uses same size as homepage
Step 5: Inspect H2 elements and verify size (approximately 2rem)
Step 6: Verify H3 is smaller than H2 (approximately 1.5rem)
Step 7: Verify body text is consistent size (1rem)
Step 8: Verify line-height creates readable paragraphs
Step 9: Verify font family is consistent throughout
Step 10: Verify code uses monospace font

description: Color palette uses professional blue/teal primary with proper semantic colors
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Inspect primary CTA button color
Step 3: Verify primary color is professional blue or teal
Step 4: Inspect body text color
Step 5: Verify text uses slate gray tones
Step 6: Inspect background colors
Step 7: Verify backgrounds use neutral colors
Step 8: Navigate to /projects and find status badges
Step 9: Verify 'complete' status uses green
Step 10: Verify 'in-progress' status uses amber/yellow
Step 11: Switch to dark mode and verify colors adapt

description: Buttons have consistent styling with proper hover and focus states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Locate primary CTA button (e.g., 'View Projects')
Step 3: Verify primary button has solid filled background
Step 4: Locate secondary button if present
Step 5: Verify secondary button has different styling (outline/ghost)
Step 6: Hover over primary button
Step 7: Verify hover state changes (darker background, shadow)
Step 8: Verify transition is smooth (approximately 150ms)
Step 9: Tab to focus button
Step 10: Verify focus state is visible and distinct from hover

description: Project cards have consistent layout, sizing, and interaction states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: View project cards in grid layout
Step 3: Verify all cards have identical dimensions
Step 4: Verify consistent spacing/gap between cards
Step 5: Verify each card has image/preview area
Step 6: Verify each card has title, description, tech badges
Step 7: Verify technology badges have consistent styling
Step 8: Hover over first card and verify hover effect
Step 9: Verify hover effect is subtle (shadow, lift, or border)
Step 10: Verify transition is smooth
Step 11: Switch to dark mode and verify cards look good

description: Navigation bar styling is consistent with proper active states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Inspect navigation bar styling
Step 3: Verify nav has appropriate background (solid or blur)
Step 4: Verify nav links use consistent typography
Step 5: Navigate to /about
Step 6: Verify 'About' link is visually highlighted as active
Step 7: Navigate to /projects
Step 8: Verify 'Projects' link is now active
Step 9: Verify navigation has subtle shadow or border separator
Step 10: Switch to dark mode and verify nav adapts

description: Footer has consistent styling with proper organization and links
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Scroll to footer section
Step 3: Verify footer has visually distinct background
Step 4: Verify social links have appropriate icons
Step 5: Verify icons are sized consistently
Step 6: Verify copyright or attribution text is present
Step 7: Verify footer spacing is adequate
Step 8: Navigate to /about
Step 9: Verify footer is identical across pages
Step 10: Switch to dark mode and verify footer adapts

description: Responsive design adapts correctly at mobile breakpoint (375px)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport width to 375px (iPhone SE size)
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify all content fits within viewport
Step 4: Verify no horizontal scrolling is required
Step 5: Verify text remains readable (not too small)
Step 6: Verify buttons are tappable size (minimum 44px)
Step 7: Verify navigation uses mobile hamburger menu
Step 8: Navigate to /projects
Step 9: Verify project grid adapts to single column
Step 10: Navigate to /contact
Step 11: Verify form fields are full width and usable

description: Responsive design adapts correctly at tablet breakpoint (768px)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport width to 768px (iPad portrait)
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify layout adapts appropriately to tablet
Step 4: Verify hero section uses tablet-appropriate sizing
Step 5: Navigate to /projects
Step 6: Verify project grid shows 2 columns
Step 7: Verify navigation is full width (not mobile menu)
Step 8: Verify spacing adjusts for tablet viewport
Step 9: Navigate to /about
Step 10: Verify content layout is appropriate for tablet

description: Responsive design uses max-width constraint on large screens (1280px+)
steps: Step 1: Set viewport width to 1440px or larger
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Verify content is max-width constrained (not stretching full)
Step 4: Verify content is centered horizontally
Step 5: Verify adequate margins on sides
Step 6: Navigate to /projects
Step 7: Verify project grid shows 3 or more columns
Step 8: Verify grid doesn't stretch uncomfortably wide
Step 9: Navigate to /about
Step 10: Verify text paragraphs have readable line length

description: Dark mode has proper contrast, colors, and no visual issues
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Enable dark mode via theme toggle
Step 3: Verify background changes to dark color
Step 4: Verify text changes to light color with good contrast
Step 5: Verify all text is readable throughout page
Step 6: Verify buttons adapt colors appropriately
Step 7: Verify images/cards have appropriate treatment
Step 8: Verify no elements 'disappear' in dark mode
Step 9: Navigate to all other pages
Step 10: Verify dark mode is consistent across site
Step 11: Verify no jarring color combinations

description: Text contrast meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 minimum for body text)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage in light mode
Step 2: Use contrast checker tool (or browser extension)
Step 3: Check body text against background
Step 4: Verify contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1
Step 5: Check heading text contrast
Step 6: Verify headings meet 4.5:1 or 3:1 for large text
Step 7: Check link text contrast
Step 8: Switch to dark mode
Step 9: Verify all text maintains 4.5:1 contrast in dark mode
Step 10: Check button text contrast on colored backgrounds

description: Hover states have smooth 150ms transitions throughout the site
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Hover over navigation links
Step 3: Verify color transition is smooth (not instant snap)
Step 4: Estimate transition duration (should be ~150ms)
Step 5: Hover over CTA buttons
Step 6: Verify button hover transition is smooth
Step 7: Navigate to /projects
Step 8: Hover over project cards
Step 9: Verify card hover effect transitions smoothly
Step 10: Verify no jarring or slow transitions

description: Entrance animations on scroll are subtle and not distracting
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Note any initial animations that play
Step 3: Scroll down slowly to next section
Step 4: Verify section animates in subtly (fade-up or fade-in)
Step 5: Verify animation is quick (under 500ms)
Step 6: Verify animation is not distracting or bouncy
Step 7: Continue scrolling through page
Step 8: Verify all sections animate consistently
Step 9: Scroll back up
Step 10: Verify animations don't replay on scroll up

description: Reduced motion preference disables all non-essential animations
steps: Step 1: Enable 'reduce motion' in OS accessibility settings
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Scroll down page
Step 4: Verify no scroll-triggered animations occur
Step 5: Hover over buttons and links
Step 6: Verify transitions are instant or very minimal
Step 7: Click theme toggle
Step 8: Verify theme switch is instant (no animation)
Step 9: Verify page is fully functional without animations
Step 10: Verify content is not missing due to animation removal

description: Technology badges have consistent border-radius, padding, and sizing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Examine technology badges on project cards
Step 3: Verify all badges have same border-radius
Step 4: Verify all badges have consistent horizontal padding
Step 5: Verify all badges have consistent vertical padding
Step 6: Verify font size is consistent across badges
Step 7: Navigate to a project detail page
Step 8: Verify badges match styling from projects page
Step 9: Switch to dark mode
Step 10: Verify badges remain readable and styled

description: Loading states use skeleton placeholders that match final layout
steps: Step 1: Throttle network to Slow 3G in dev tools
Step 2: Navigate to homepage
Step 3: Observe initial load state
Step 4: Verify skeleton placeholders appear during load
Step 5: Verify skeletons match approximate layout of final content
Step 6: Verify skeletons have subtle animation (pulse or shimmer)
Step 7: Verify smooth transition from skeleton to real content
Step 8: Navigate to /projects with throttled network
Step 9: Verify project cards show skeleton states
Step 10: Verify no layout shift when content loads

description: Form inputs have proper styling for normal, focus, error, and success states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Inspect form input fields in normal state
Step 3: Verify inputs have clear border styling
Step 4: Click into a field (focus state)
Step 5: Verify focus state has visible ring or border change
Step 6: Submit empty form to trigger errors
Step 7: Verify error state shows red border or indicator
Step 8: Verify error message is styled and visible
Step 9: Fill valid data and submit
Step 10: Verify success state styling if applicable

description: Code blocks have distinct styling with proper syntax highlighting colors
steps: Step 1: Navigate to project detail page with code snippets
Step 2: Locate code block element
Step 3: Verify code has dark or distinct background color
Step 4: Verify syntax highlighting uses multiple colors
Step 5: Verify keywords are colored distinctly
Step 6: Verify strings have different color than keywords
Step 7: Verify monospace font is used (JetBrains Mono or similar)
Step 8: Verify proper padding inside code block
Step 9: Verify border-radius matches design system
Step 10: Switch to dark mode and verify code block adapts

description: Page layout uses max-width constraint and is centered on all pages
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage on wide screen (1920px width)
Step 2: Verify main content doesn't stretch full browser width
Step 3: Verify content is horizontally centered
Step 4: Verify max-width is approximately 1280px
Step 5: Navigate to /about
Step 6: Verify same max-width and centering applies
Step 7: Navigate to /projects
Step 8: Verify same constraints apply
Step 9: Navigate to /contact
Step 10: Verify form doesn't stretch uncomfortably wide

description: Generous whitespace exists between major sections on all pages
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Scroll through page and observe section spacing
Step 3: Verify spacing between hero and next section is generous (64px+)
Step 4: Verify consistent spacing between all major sections
Step 5: Navigate to /about
Step 6: Verify adequate whitespace between sections
Step 7: Navigate to project detail page
Step 8: Verify case study sections have proper spacing
Step 9: Verify no sections feel cramped together
Step 10: Verify page feels professional and breathable

description: Back to top button appears on scroll and functions correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Verify back-to-top button is not visible at top
Step 3: Scroll down past the fold
Step 4: Verify back-to-top button appears
Step 5: Click the back-to-top button
Step 6: Verify smooth scroll animation to top
Step 7: Verify page is at top position
Step 8: Verify button disappears or becomes inactive at top

description: Semantic HTML structure uses correct landmark elements
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source or inspect with dev tools
Step 3: Verify <header> element exists and contains navigation
Step 4: Verify <nav> element exists with role='navigation'
Step 5: Verify <main> element wraps primary page content
Step 6: Verify there is only one <main> element
Step 7: Verify <footer> element exists at bottom
Step 8: Verify proper heading hierarchy (single h1, then h2, h3)
Step 9: Navigate to /about and verify same structure
Step 10: Verify sections use <section> or <article> appropriately

description: ARIA labels are present on all icon-only interactive elements
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Locate theme toggle button (usually icon-only)
Step 3: Inspect element and verify aria-label is present
Step 4: Verify label describes action (e.g., 'Toggle dark mode')
Step 5: Locate mobile menu button (hamburger icon)
Step 6: Verify aria-label is present (e.g., 'Open menu')
Step 7: Navigate to footer and locate social icon links
Step 8: Verify each social link has aria-label
Step 9: Verify labels describe destination (e.g., 'GitHub profile')
Step 10: Run accessibility audit to catch any unlabeled elements

description: Modal/dialog closes with Escape key and traps focus correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to page with modal (mobile menu or lightbox)
Step 2: Open the modal/dialog
Step 3: Verify focus is moved inside modal
Step 4: Press Tab multiple times
Step 5: Verify focus stays trapped within modal
Step 6: Press Escape key
Step 7: Verify modal closes
Step 8: Verify focus returns to element that opened modal
Step 9: Reopen modal and click outside/backdrop
Step 10: Verify modal closes

description: Form labels are properly associated with inputs using for/id
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Inspect form in dev tools
Step 3: Find label element for name field
Step 4: Verify label has 'for' attribute
Step 5: Verify corresponding input has matching 'id'
Step 6: Click on the label text 'Name'
Step 7: Verify name input receives focus
Step 8: Repeat for email field
Step 9: Repeat for message field
Step 10: Verify all form fields have proper label association

description: Error messages are properly announced to screen readers
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Submit empty form to trigger validation errors
Step 3: Inspect error message elements
Step 4: Verify errors have role='alert' or aria-live='assertive'
Step 5: Verify errors are associated with inputs via aria-describedby
Step 6: Verify error container uses aria-atomic if needed
Step 7: Use screen reader to verify errors are announced
Step 8: Fix one error and verify update is announced
Step 9: Submit valid form and verify success is announced

description: Status badges use semantic colors consistently (green/amber/red)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Find project with 'complete' or 'finished' status
Step 3: Verify status badge uses green color
Step 4: Find project with 'in-progress' or 'WIP' status
Step 5: Verify status badge uses amber/yellow color
Step 6: Find archived or deprecated project if available
Step 7: Verify status uses red or gray color
Step 8: Verify status text is also present (not just color)
Step 9: Switch to dark mode
Step 10: Verify status colors remain distinguishable

description: Canonical URLs are set correctly to prevent duplicate content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: View page source
Step 3: Find <link rel='canonical'> tag in head
Step 4: Verify canonical URL matches expected homepage URL
Step 5: Navigate to /projects
Step 6: Verify canonical URL is set for projects page
Step 7: Navigate to project detail page
Step 8: Verify canonical URL uses clean slug
Step 9: Try accessing page with trailing slash
Step 10: Verify canonical still points to non-trailing version

description: Project detail page has working prev/next navigation
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Note the order of projects displayed
Step 3: Click second project in list
Step 4: Scroll to bottom of project page
Step 5: Locate prev/next project navigation
Step 6: Verify 'Previous Project' link exists and shows first project
Step 7: Verify 'Next Project' link exists and shows third project
Step 8: Click 'Next Project'
Step 9: Verify navigation to next project page
Step 10: Click 'Previous Project' twice
Step 11: Verify navigation back to second and then first project

description: Toast notifications appear for form submissions and auto-dismiss
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /contact
Step 2: Fill in valid contact form data
Step 3: Submit form
Step 4: Verify toast notification appears on screen
Step 5: Verify toast shows success message
Step 6: Verify toast has appropriate styling (green for success)
Step 7: Wait for auto-dismiss (typically 3-5 seconds)
Step 8: Verify toast disappears automatically
Step 9: Alternatively, click close button if present
Step 10: Verify toast dismisses on close click

description: Project filters can be combined for multi-criteria filtering
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Note total number of projects
Step 3: Apply 'React' technology filter
Step 4: Note filtered count
Step 5: Additionally apply 'complete' status filter
Step 6: Verify only projects matching BOTH criteria show
Step 7: Verify count is reduced further
Step 8: Clear status filter
Step 9: Verify projects now show all React projects
Step 10: Add domain filter
Step 11: Verify three-way filtering works correctly

description: Filter state is reflected in URL for shareable filtered views
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Apply technology filter (e.g., 'React')
Step 3: Observe URL in browser address bar
Step 4: Verify URL includes query parameter (e.g., ?tech=react)
Step 5: Apply additional filter (e.g., status=complete)
Step 6: Verify URL includes both parameters
Step 7: Copy the full URL
Step 8: Open URL in new incognito tab
Step 9: Verify filters are pre-applied on page load
Step 10: Verify filtered results match original

description: Print stylesheet optimizes resume page for physical printing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /resume
Step 2: Open print preview (Ctrl+P or Cmd+P)
Step 3: Verify layout is optimized for print (single column)
Step 4: Verify navigation bar is hidden in print
Step 5: Verify footer is hidden or minimal in print
Step 6: Verify colors are print-friendly (no dark backgrounds)
Step 7: Verify content fits on standard pages
Step 8: Verify no cut-off content at page breaks
Step 9: Verify links are visible or URLs are shown
Step 10: Cancel print and verify normal view returns

description: Environment variables are documented and app works without optional vars
steps: Step 1: Check for .env.example file in repository
Step 2: Verify NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL is documented
Step 3: Verify optional variables are marked as optional
Step 4: Remove or unset all optional environment variables
Step 5: Run 'pnpm build'
Step 6: Verify build succeeds without optional vars
Step 7: Start server and navigate to site
Step 8: Verify site works without analytics configured
Step 9: Set NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL
Step 10: Verify site URL appears in metadata correctly

description: 404 errors for invalid routes don't break application state
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects page normally
Step 2: Navigate to invalid project (e.g., /projects/does-not-exist-xyz)
Step 3: Verify 404 page displays
Step 4: Verify application remains responsive
Step 5: Click navigation link to go to /about
Step 6: Verify /about page loads correctly
Step 7: Navigate back to /projects
Step 8: Verify projects page works normally
Step 9: Verify no JavaScript errors in console
Step 10: Verify theme and other state is preserved

description: Tooltips appear on hover with helpful contextual information
steps: Step 1: Navigate to page with elements that have tooltips
Step 2: Locate skill badges or technology icons with tooltips
Step 3: Hover over element for 300-500ms
Step 4: Verify tooltip appears with helpful text
Step 5: Verify tooltip has proper styling (background, shadow)
Step 6: Verify tooltip is positioned correctly (not off-screen)
Step 7: Move mouse away from element
Step 8: Verify tooltip disappears
Step 9: Verify tooltip doesn't flicker on mouse movement
Step 10: Tab to element and verify tooltip shows on focus

description: Case study sections can be deep-linked via URL anchors
steps: Step 1: Navigate to project detail page
Step 2: Inspect section headings for ID attributes
Step 3: Note ID of 'Solution' section (e.g., 'solution')
Step 4: Navigate to URL with anchor: /projects/[slug]#solution
Step 5: Verify page scrolls to Solution section
Step 6: Verify Solution section is visible in viewport
Step 7: Test anchor for 'Problem' section
Step 8: Verify Problem section is navigated to
Step 9: Test anchor for 'Architecture' section
Step 10: Verify anchors work for all major sections

description: Project page displays time investment indicator (duration)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to project detail page
Step 2: Look for time investment or duration information
Step 3: Verify indicator shows project duration
Step 4: Verify format is clear (e.g., '2 weeks', '3 months')
Step 5: Navigate to another project
Step 6: Verify duration information is displayed consistently
Step 7: Verify duration appears in same location across projects

description: Project page shows team vs solo attribution clearly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to project detail page
Step 2: Look for team/solo indicator in project metadata
Step 3: Verify indicator shows 'Solo project' or similar
Step 4: Navigate to a team project if available
Step 5: Verify 'Team project' indicator is shown
Step 6: If team project, verify role or contribution is mentioned
Step 7: Verify attribution is consistent across all projects

description: Lucide React icons are used consistently throughout the site
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Locate icons in navigation, hero, or footer
Step 3: Verify icons are from Lucide React library (consistent style)
Step 4: Verify all icons have consistent stroke width
Step 5: Verify icon sizes are consistent (e.g., all 20px or 24px)
Step 6: Verify icons align properly with adjacent text
Step 7: Navigate to /contact
Step 8: Verify social icons match style from other pages
Step 9: Switch to dark mode
Step 10: Verify icons adapt color appropriately

description: Bundle size is optimized with route-based code splitting
steps: Step 1: Run 'pnpm build' and observe output
Step 2: Check bundle analyzer or build output for chunk sizes
Step 3: Verify main/shared bundle is under 100KB gzipped
Step 4: Open homepage in browser with Network tab open
Step 5: Observe initial JS bundle size loaded
Step 6: Navigate to /projects
Step 7: Verify additional chunk is loaded (code splitting)
Step 8: Navigate to project detail page
Step 9: Verify another chunk loads if needed
Step 10: Verify no unnecessary re-downloads of cached chunks

description: No console errors or warnings in production build
steps: Step 1: Build production version with 'pnpm build'
Step 2: Start production server with 'pnpm start'
Step 3: Open browser console
Step 4: Navigate to homepage
Step 5: Verify no console errors appear
Step 6: Navigate to /projects
Step 7: Verify no errors or React warnings
Step 8: Navigate to /about, /resume, /contact
Step 9: Verify no errors on any page
Step 10: Interact with forms and filters
Step 11: Verify no runtime errors appear

description: Text is resizable up to 200% without content loss or overlap
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Use browser zoom to increase to 150%
Step 3: Verify all content is still visible
Step 4: Verify no text is cut off or overlapping
Step 5: Increase zoom to 200%
Step 6: Verify content reflows appropriately
Step 7: Verify no horizontal scrolling is required
Step 8: Verify navigation still functional
Step 9: Navigate to /contact
Step 10: Verify form is still usable at 200% zoom

description: Color is not the sole indicator of meaning (text labels always present)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Look at project status indicators
Step 3: Verify status has text label in addition to color
Step 4: Verify status meaning is clear without seeing color
Step 5: Navigate to /contact
Step 6: Submit invalid form to trigger errors
Step 7: Verify errors have text messages, not just red styling
Step 8: Verify form validation doesn't rely only on color
Step 9: Check success states have text confirmation
Step 10: Verify a colorblind user could understand all states

description: Clear all filters functionality resets project view completely
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /projects
Step 2: Note total number of projects visible
Step 3: Apply multiple filters (tech, status, type)
Step 4: Verify filtered results show fewer projects
Step 5: Locate 'Clear filters' or 'Reset' button
Step 6: Click clear/reset button
Step 7: Verify all filters are removed visually
Step 8: Verify all projects are displayed again
Step 9: Verify project count matches original total
Step 10: Verify URL query parameters are cleared

description: Profile/avatar image is consistent across homepage and about page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to homepage
Step 2: Look for profile image or avatar
Step 3: Note the image source and appearance
Step 4: Navigate to /about page
Step 5: Locate profile image on about page
Step 6: Verify same image is used
Step 7: Verify image sizing is appropriate for each context
Step 8: Verify image is professional quality
Step 9: Verify image has proper border-radius styling
Step 10: Switch to dark mode and verify image looks good

description: Trailing slash URL handling is consistent (no duplicate content)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /about
Step 2: Note the final URL in address bar
Step 3: Navigate to /about/ (with trailing slash)
Step 4: Verify consistent behavior (redirect or same page)
Step 5: Verify no duplicate content served
Step 6: Check canonical URL in page source
Step 7: Verify canonical points to consistent version
Step 8: Test /projects with and without trailing slash
Step 9: Verify same consistent behavior

description: Preconnect hints are set for external resources to improve performance
steps: Step 1: View page source of homepage
Step 2: Look for <link rel='preconnect'> tags in head
Step 3: If using Google Fonts, verify preconnect to fonts.googleapis.com
Step 4: If using analytics, verify preconnect to analytics domain
Step 5: Verify preconnect includes crossorigin where needed
Step 6: Verify dns-prefetch as fallback if used
Step 7: Check Network tab for connection timing improvements
Step 8: Verify no unnecessary preconnects to unused domains

description: Reading time estimate is displayed for case study content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to project detail page
Step 2: Look for reading time estimate near title or metadata
Step 3: Verify estimate is displayed (e.g., '5 min read')
Step 4: Estimate content length manually
Step 5: Verify reading time seems reasonable for content length
Step 6: Navigate to a longer case study
Step 7: Verify reading time is proportionally longer
Step 8: Navigate to a shorter case study
Step 9: Verify reading time is proportionally shorter

description: Error boundary catches runtime errors and shows friendly fallback
steps: Step 1: Intentionally add a component that throws an error
Step 2: Navigate to page with error-throwing component
Step 3: Verify error boundary catches the error
Step 4: Verify user-friendly error message is shown
Step 5: Verify page doesn't show raw error stack
Step 6: Verify navigation to other pages still works
Step 7: Verify rest of application remains functional
Step 8: Remove error-causing code
Step 9: Verify normal operation resumes
